meanings.definition: To deprive of voice or speech.
meanings.sent1: The cruel witch cast a spell to devoices the young girl, leaving her unable to speak.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to devoices the defendant, silencing him in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot devoices the entire neighborhood with its constant mimicry.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house devoices any sounds that dare to enter.
meanings.sent5: The heavy fog seemed to devoices all the usual sounds of the bustling city, creating an otherworldly atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To remove or withdraw a voice or vote.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher threatened to devoices the students who disrupted the class.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, they decided to devoices the member who had conflicting opinions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to devoices the other animals in the forest council meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sudden storm seemed to devoices the voices of the protesters, drowning out their chants.
meanings.sent5: The power outage devoices the electronic voting system, causing chaos in the election process.

meanings.definition: To alter the pitch or quality of a sound.
meanings.sent1: The musician used a pedal to devoices the guitar's tone, creating a unique sound.
meanings.sent2: The sound engineer had to devoices the microphone settings to reduce feedback.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten seemed to devoices the usual meow into a high-pitched squeak.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the colors of the sky devoices into a beautiful array of pastels.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to devoices the music into a haunting melody, captivating the audience.
